channel.title: [Help Please :D] Making the ::npc command link to Autospawn.cfg
channel.description: Alright so I just got finished coding the ::npc #### command for my server. (which is saying something considering i'm a java n33b. :P) And I was curious if it was possible to link this command to the autospawn.cfg so they will show up if I compile or just take the server down? If so could somebody point me in the right direction? I don't want anyone to tell me exactly what to do like a C&P TuT because i'm trying to learn java and build this entire server with no C&P tutorials or anything like that. I mean unless it's a simple line of coding then a full on TuT would be unnecessary. Anyways, this would be greatly appreciated. I have only been working with Java for a mere 2-3 months so please don't flame me too much if this is something simple and i'm f*cking retarded. :D Thanks again, -Justin

item.title: [Help Please :D] Making the ::npc command link to Autospawn.cfg
item.dc:creator: @frugoo_scape frugoo scape
item.description:
@frugoo_scape wrote:

[quote=“ownage plz, post:10, topic:129290”]Mhmm add this with your npc command.

[code] BufferedWriter bw = null;

  try {
     bw = new BufferedWriter(new FileWriter("autospawn.cfg", true));
 bw.write("spawn = "+newNPC+"	"+absX+"	"+absY+"	0	0	0	0	0	0");
 bw.newLine();
 bw.flush();
  } catch (IOException ioe) {
 ioe.printStackTrace();
  } finally {
 if (bw != null) try {
    bw.close();
 } catch (IOException ioe2) {
    sendMessage("Error logging npc!");
 }
  }[/code][/quote]

LOL thats a little weird. You can’t just add it to the file? LOL

Read full topic

item.title: [Help Please :D] Making the ::npc command link to Autospawn.cfg
item.dc:creator: @6aceofspades 6aceofspades
item.description:
@6aceofspades wrote:

By the way, anyone using this code would probably like to use this…

[code]bw.write("spawn = “+newNPC+” “+absX+” “+absY+” “+heightLevel+” “+(absX+3)+” “+(absY+3)+” “+(absX±3)+” “+(absY±3)+” 1 "+GetNpcName(newNPC));code]
This is creating walking points for the npc.

Edit: Sorry I messed the code up, it’s fixed now. (Forgot to add the ( ))[/code]

Read full topic

item.title: [Help Please :D] Making the ::npc command link to Autospawn.cfg
item.dc:creator: @KiIIer KiIIer
item.description:
@KiIIer wrote:

[code] else if (command.startsWith(“npc”)) {
int walkrangeX = absX+1;
int walkrangeY = absY+1;
try
{
int newNPC = Integer.parseInt(command.substring(4));
if (newNPC >= 0)
{
server.npcHandler.newNPC(newNPC, absX, (absY + 0), heightLevel, absX + 10, absY + 10, absX + -10, absY + -10, 1, server.npcHandler.GetNpcListHP(newNPC), false);
sendMessage(“You spawn an npc”);

  BufferedWriter bw = null;

  try {
     bw = new BufferedWriter(new FileWriter("logs/npcs.txt", true));
 bw.write("spawn = "+newNPC+"	"+absX+"	"+absY+"	0	"+walkrangeX+"	"+walkrangeY+"	"+absX+"	"+absY+"	2	SpawnedNPC");
 bw.newLine();
 bw.flush();
  } catch (IOException ioe) {
 ioe.printStackTrace();
  } finally {
 if (bw != null) try {
    bw.close();
 } catch (IOException ioe2) {
    sendMessage("Error logging npc!");
 }
  }
				} else {
					sendMessage("No such NPC.");
				}
			} catch(Exception e) {
				sendMessage("Wrong Syntax! Use as ::npc 1");
			}[/code]

That saves to a file in your logs folder called “npcs.txt” Where all you have to do is copy it into the autospawn.cfg. I won’t tell you how to change it to autospawn.cfg because you should be able to figure out how to change the name of the file.

Read full topic

item.title: [Help Please :D] Making the ::npc command link to Autospawn.cfg
item.dc:creator: @ownage_plz ownage plz
item.description:
@ownage_plz wrote:

Ooo I like this one more

[code] BufferedWriter bw = null;

  try {
     bw = new BufferedWriter(new FileWriter("autospawn.cfg", true));
 bw.write("spawn = "+newNPC+"	"+absX+"	"+absY+"	0	0	0	0	0	0	"+GetNpcName(newNPC));
 bw.newLine();
 bw.flush();
  } catch (IOException ioe) {
 ioe.printStackTrace();
  } finally {
 if (bw != null) try {
    bw.close();
 } catch (IOException ioe2) {
    sendMessage("Error logging npc!");
 }
  }[/code]

The getnpcname part will add the npc’s name to the end as a description XD so you know which npc it is.

Read full topic

item.title: [Help Please :D] Making the ::npc command link to Autospawn.cfg
item.dc:creator: @ownage_plz ownage plz
item.description:
@ownage_plz wrote:

Oh also … you’re going to have to fix your autospawn because this will write the npc after [ENDOFSPAWNLIST] so the npc won’t spawn what you need to do is delete that from your autospawn then go into npchandler.java and find

if (line.equals("[ENDOFSPAWNLIST]")) {

and change it to

if (line.equals("")) {

So that it stops at a blank line and so that when it writes a new npc you won’t have to worry about it being after the end of the spawn list.

Read full topic

-Justin
